borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p><span style="font-size: 11pt;">5.&nbsp;The submission has failed to adequately demonstrate that the proposal would not result in increased parking </span><span style="font-size: 14.6667px;">pressures</span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">&nbsp;within the vicinity to the detriment of occupiers along Burnside Road, particularly No.136 and No.138. As such, officers are unable to accurately ensure that the proposal would not result in undue harm as a result of </span><span style="font-size: 14.6667px;">vehicular</span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">&nbsp;movement, detrimental to local highways. The proposal is therefore contrary to:&nbsp;</span></p><p><span style="font-size:11pt;">&nbsp;National Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021)</span></p><p><span style="font-size:11pt;">&nbsp;- Policies T4&nbsp;and T6 of the London Plan (March 2021)</span></p><p><span style="font-size:11pt;">&nbsp;- Policies BR9 and BR10 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)</span></p><p><span style="font-size:11pt;">&nbsp;- Policies DMT2 of&nbsp; The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:11pt">The development, by reason of the access to the first floor female&nbsp;prayer room via&nbsp;<span arial="">the unlit service road off Burnside Road, fails to provide a safe and appropriate entrance for visitors whereby the arrangement would merge pedestrians with vehicles and deliveries for the commercial units along Green Lane. The outward opening doors across&nbsp;the</span></span><span style="font-size:11pt">&nbsp;site would impede pedestrian and vehicular movements and would result in an unsafe and impractical arrangement. Level access is not provided across the site, no lift access is provided to the female&nbsp;only first floor, and there are no disabled toilets to the first floor. The proposal fails to provide a safe </span><span style="font-size:11pt"> and inclusive access for all, and is contrary to:</span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:11pt">- Policy GG1 and Policy D5 of the London Plan (2021)</span></p><p><span style="font-size:11pt">- Policy DMD1 and DMS1 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size: 11pt;">&nbsp;<span arial="">The proposed first and second floor extension, by reason of siting, scale and design,&nbsp;would result in a harmful loss of daylight, sunlight and outlook to surrounding properties, most notably No.796 and No.794 Green Lane. The access </span>to the first floor female&nbsp;prayer room via&nbsp;<span arial="">the unlit service road off Burnside Road would result in additional noise and disturbance resulting from comings and goings along the service road to the detriment of occupiers at No.136 and No.138&nbsp;Burnside Road.&nbsp;</span></span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">The proposal constitutes an unneighbourly design, detrimental to the amenities of residents within proximity of the site, contrary to:&nbsp;</span><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">:<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">- National
Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021)
<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">- Policy D4 of
the London Plan (March 2021)<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">&nbsp;- Policy CP3 of Local Development Framework
(LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010) <o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">- Policies BP8
and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan
Document (DPD) (March 2011) <o:p></o:p></span></p><p>









</p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">- Policies SP2
and DMD1 DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan:
(Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:7.5pt;line-height:normal"><span style="font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">The proposed <span style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51); background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial;">first and second floor rear and side extension at 798 Green
Lane, by reason of its discordant design<i> </i>and incongruous roof room is
not considered amenable to the site context of Green Lane. The first and second
floor extension visible from the front elevation fail to retain the character and
symmetry of the terrace row. From the rear, the first-floor rear extension roof
form is overly large and introduces a disconcordant feature to the rear of the
site. The positioning of the windows on the rear and side elevation do not
appear balanced or retaining symmetry. </span>The development is considered to
constitute undue harm to the character and appearance of the site and
surrounding area. As such,&nbsp;it is considered unacceptable and contrary to:<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:7.5pt;line-height:normal"><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">- National Planning Policy Framework
National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021) <o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:7.5pt;line-height:normal"><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">- Policy D4 of the London Plan (March
2021)<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:7.5pt;line-height:normal"><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">&nbsp;- Policy CP3 of the Local Development
Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010) <o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:7.5pt;line-height:normal"><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local
Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March
2011) <o:p></o:p></span></p><p>









</p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom:7.5pt;line-height:normal"><span style="font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">- Policies SP2 and DMD1 of The London
Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission
Version, December 2021)<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p style="margin:0cm"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">The applicant has failed to present plans which accurately portray
the development present at the application site. Specifically the plans fail to
demonstrate a consistent roof form to the rear of the site. The proposal could
prejudice third parties who may otherwise have wished to comment on the
application; the proposed development cannot be accurately assessed and it
cannot be demonstrated that it would be supported by the Development Plan. As
such, the proposed development is contrary to:&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></p><p style="margin:0cm"><span style="font-size:11.0pt;font-family:&quot;Arial&quot;,sans-serif">&nbsp;</span></p><p style="margin-top:0cm;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:7.0pt;margin-left:0cm"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">- National
Planning Policy Framework&nbsp;National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF)
(DLUHC, 2021)<o:p></o:p></span></p><p style="margin-top:0cm;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:7.0pt;margin-left:0cm"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">- Policy D4
of the London Plan (March 2021)<o:p></o:p></span></p><p style="margin-top:0cm;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:7.0pt;margin-left:0cm"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">- Policy
CP3 of the&nbsp;Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)<o:p></o:p></span></p><p style="margin-top:0cm;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:7.0pt;margin-left:0cm"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">- Policies
BP8 and BP11 of the&nbsp;Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide
Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)<o:p></o:p></span></p><p style="margin-top:0cm;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:7.0pt;margin-left:0cm"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">- The
Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February
2012)<o:p></o:p></span></p><p>













</p><p style="margin-top:0cm;margin-right:0cm;margin-bottom:7.0pt;margin-left:0cm"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif;">- Policies
SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of&nbsp;The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft
Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)<o:p></o:p></span></p>
description: Construction of a first floor rear and side extension and second floor rear and side extension including seven dormers and two roof lights
